dict.string: A simple yet powerful todo list manager
Select a home folder for Todo

python todo.py -a "{query}" # sh action.sh "{query}"
# Check if last action was copy to clipboard # Then we do not want Alfred to popup back up ACTION=$(python config.py -get todo.command.last) if [ $ACTION == 'copy_to_clipboard' ]; then exit elif [ $ACTION == 'open_url' ]; then exit fi
# Pop Alfred back up TAG=$(python config.py -get todo.tag.recent) HAD_TAG=$(python config.py -get todo.user.query.hastag) if [ $ACTION == 'display_tags' ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo $TAG \"" elif [ $HAD_TAG == 'False' ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo \"" else osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo $TAG \"" fi

python todo.py -r "{query}"
# Pop Alfred back up TAG=$(python config.py -get todo.tag.recent) HAD_TAG=$(python config.py -get todo.user.query.hastag) COMMAND=$(python config.py -get todo.command.last) if [ $COMMAND == 'remove_tag' ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo #\"" elif [ $HAD_TAG == 'False' ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo \"" else osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo $TAG \"" fi

python todo.py -p "{query}" TAG=$(python config.py -get todo.tag.recent) HAD_TAG=$(python config.py -get todo.user.query.hastag) if [ $HAD_TAG == 'False' ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo \"" else osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo $TAG \"" fi

python todo.py -d "{query}"
# Pop Alfred back up TAG=$(python config.py -get todo.tag.recent) HAD_TAG=$(python config.py -get todo.user.query.hastag) COMMAND=$(python config.py -get todo.command.last) if [ $COMMAND == 'remove_tag' ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo #\"" elif [ $HAD_TAG == 'False' ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo \"" else osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo $TAG \"" fi
Manage a todo list using Alfred
python config.py -put todo.edit.item "{query}" osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"edit \""

python todo.py -r "{query}"
# Pop Alfred back up TAG=$(python config.py -get todo.tag.recent) HAD_TAG=$(python config.py -get todo.user.query.hastag) if [ $HAD_TAG == 'False' ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"done \"" else osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"done $TAG\"" fi
python todo.py -d "{query}" osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"done \""
python config.py -reset echo "Preferences reset to their defaults"

python import.py -file "{query}"
osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo \""

python edit.py -action "{query}"
LASTACTION=$(python config.py -get todo.edit.lastaction) if [ $LASTACTION == 'integration' ]; then COMMAND=$(python config.py -get todo.edit.integration.command) osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"$COMMAND\"" elif [ $LASTACTION == 'edit_tag' ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo #\"" elif [ $LASTACTION == 'edit_done' ]; then osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"done \"" else osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"todo \"" fi
Enable or disable features in Todo
python features.py -toggle "{query}" osascript -e "tell application \"Alfred 2\" to search \"features\""
Set default format for Todo lists

TODO_DB=$(python config.py -get todo.db) TARGET=~/Desktop/todo_export.csv
python export_csv.py "$TODO_DB" "$TARGET"
echo Exported to "$TARGET"
